habitat_description:
This species occupies southeastern Nebraska, Wisconsin, Iowa, and Indiana into the Gulf Coast that comprises Texas and Louisiana (Conant and Collins 1991) and east to Atlantic. This species has two subspecies that have distinctly different ranges (Eastern and Western) The habitats found throughout this range are characterized by prairie, open grassland, open woodland, oak savannas, longleaf pine flatwoods, fallow fields, and scrubby areas. This species has also been found in proximity to streams and ponds, but also dry sandy habitats.

UM	 -Critically imperiled and restricted to wetlands, and edges of ponds and streams.
GP - 	Open grassland, prairie, woodland margins, longleaf pine woods, savanna, scrubby areas, fallow fields, riparian zones, conifer woodland, and cropland-hedgerow.
SE	 - Hardwood woodland, herbaceous woodland, hardwood woodland, near streams and ponds, cropland, and oak savannas.
